column1: A type of Parasitic Infection - Babesiosis
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: While the form of medication is odd (bright yellow, thick liquid, odd taste) it is easy to measure, and take.  Taste isn't too bad, and best to take with food, so that helps "chase" it.  I've had one bout of nausea/vomit after 6 weeks of tx.  Not sure exact effectiveness since I'm on multiple meds plus meds for Lyme: Azithromiacin, Cryptolepis oil, fish oil, pro-biotics, vitamin D... but since starting these treatments I'm feeling much better, much more energetic.  Recently I've been finding throat tightening up into roof of mouth, ear and head which I thought related to work stress, however, I just found out this is one of the potential side effects, as are anxiety and sleep difficulty (experiencing all, thought to be related to work stress, but not my typical reaction to stress).  I'm very impressed by the price of the medication: $2,400, but thanks to my insurance coverage, I paid 25$ for a month supply (twice daily teaspoon).  Now this yellow liquid seems more like precious gold to me.

column2: Praise, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication about 2 mths ago and now I'm free from taking it anymore. It has kept me free from harm and has completed it's task tp prevent pcp. I felt nausea a couple of times but nothing major, A very bitter taste but i have finished the course with the help of God. I payed that the medication be a healing not a sickness to me.

column2: ringer, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: This med is very difficult to get used to taking due to the very offensive color and thickness/texture of this drug. I would much rather take a pill than to have to take a liquid form! It is like trying to swallow thick flourescent yellow paint.

column2: JohnDuke, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Tastes awful but effective in that despite low blood counts, no pulmonary illness.I have taken 10 ml/day for a year.I also noted it cured my toenail fungus!I receive medication in 210 ml bottle and use teaspoon to measure.  Much more convenient [and less expensive] than 5 ml packets.

column2: Mousse, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Side effects can come on gradual and "sneak" up on you, especially mood/behavioral changes and appetite changes.  Be sure to know what the side effects are and be on the look out for even small changes before they get too severe.

column9: Taking mepron as a preventive after a liver transplant.Find it difficult to measure it is very thick and sticky.I use a empty 10ml syringe to measure.the taste is awful.
